entry.et: obsolete stock to cover with a stocking

def.dt: :a usually knit close-fitting covering for the foot and leg
:sock
:something resembling a stocking
:a ring of distinctive color on the lower part of the leg of an animal
:with the feet in stockings but not shoes
:to make (a domestic animal) pregnant
:to fit to or with a stock
:to provide with stock or a stock :supply stock a stream with trout
:to procure or keep a stock of our store stocks that brand
:to graze (livestock) on land
:to send out new shoots
:to put in stock or supplies stock up on canned goods
:a long knitted cone-shaped cap with a tassel or pom-pom worn especially for winter sports or play
:a small gift suitable for placing in a Christmas stocking
:a usually sheer close-fitting one-piece garment for the torso that often has sleeves and legs
:an aristocratic or wealthy person
:a fashionably dressed person
:federalist 2
:aristocratic wealthy a silk–stocking district a silk–stocking law firm
:fashionably dressed a silk–stocking audience
:of or relating to the American Federalist party
